ns0:entry.ns0:title: [The Verge]How BlackBerry Messenger lost the messaging wars | Version History

ns2:group.ns2:title: How BlackBerry Messenger lost the messaging wars | Version History
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Back when text messages cost 10 cents each, BlackBerry came up with a better way: BlackBerry Messenger, commonly known as BBM. It was the first new idea about messaging in a long time, and it was a huge hitâ€¦ for a while. Nilay Patel and Joanna Stern join David Pierce to talk about a messaging service that was years ahead of WhatsApp and iMessage, but ultimately fizzled. #VersionHistory #Podcast #Technology
0:00 The Rise of Text Messaging Costs in 2005 00:31 Introduction to BBM: A Game Changer 00:58 The Nostalgia of Early 2000s Phones 01:30 The Blackberry Era: A Cultural Phenomenon 02:01 The Birth of BBM: Revolutionizing Messaging 05:06 The Instant Messaging Boom of 2005 10:34 The Technical Backbone of Blackberry 12:53 BBM's Unique Features and Rapid Growth 26:41 The Decline of Blackberry and Rise of Competitors 30:25 BBM's Last Stand: Attempts to Save Blackberry 31:10 The Rise and Fall of BBM's Super App Vision 32:30 The Stickiness of Messaging Apps and the iPhone's Impact 33:49 WhatsApp's Emergence and BBM's Missed Opportunities 36:22 The 2011 BBM Outage and Its Aftermath 37:25 BBM's Last Stand and the 2013 Spin-Off Attempt 39:10 The Decline of BBM and the Rise of WhatsApp 41:13 Reflecting on BBM's Legacy and Missed Potential 42:27 Version History Questions: BBM's Best and Worst Features 49:08 Could BBM Have Been Saved? 58:24 Final Thoughts and Conclusion

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [TED]TED Talks Daily Book Club: A Little Daylight Left | Sarah Kay | TED

ns2:group.ns2:title: TED Talks Daily Book Club: A Little Daylight Left | Sarah Kay | TED
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Sarah Kay is a spoken word poet and the author of the new poetry collection "A Little Daylight Left." In this TED Talks Daily Book Club interview with host Elise Hu, Kay reflects on her relationship with poetry â€” from reading the poems her parents left in her lunchbox to frequenting the local dive barâ€™s weekly poetry slam to becoming an â€œaccidental ambassadorâ€ of spoken word. She also talks about how she uses different artistic mediums to invite others into poetry, showing how the art form can open you to community, healing and vulnerability.
The TED Talks Daily Book Club series features TED speakers discussing their latest books and exploring their ideas beyond the page. Stay tuned to our feed for more interviews like this one and for special live book club events open exclusively to TED members. (Recorded at A TED Original Podcast on June 3, 2025

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [Amazon Web Services]AWS AI Agent Hackathon: Shape the Future of AI Agents | Amazon Web Services

ns2:group.ns2:title: AWS AI Agent Hackathon: Shape the Future of AI Agents | Amazon Web Services
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Join AWS distinguished engineers and senior leaders as they explore why AI agents represent the next frontier in software development. Learn why the time is now, and why AWS is the best place to build them.
Discover how AWS is transforming AI agent development, and the opportunities available through the AWS AI Agent Hackathon. With $45,000 in prizes, access to AWS experts, and a path to market through AWS Marketplace, builders at every level - from students to enterprises - can leverage the same AI capabilities powering industry-leading software products.
Join us in shaping the future of AI agents - register now, and submit your entry by October 20: https://go.aws/4mZJSw4
Subscribe to AWS: https://go.aws/subscribe
Create a free AWS account: https://go.aws/signup Try AWS for free: https://go.aws/free Connect with an expert: https://go.aws/contact Explore more: https://go.aws/more
Next steps: Explore on AWS in Analyst Research: https://go.aws/reports Discover, deploy, and manage software that runs on AWS: https://go.aws/marketplace Join the AWS Partner Network: https://go.aws/partners Learn more on how Amazon builds and operates software: https://go.aws/library
Do you have technical AWS questions? Ask the community of experts on AWS re:Post: https://go.aws/3lPaoPb
Why AWS? Amazon Web Services is the worldâ€™s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud, enabling customers to build anything they can imagine. We offer the greatest choice of innovative cloud capabilities and expertise, on the most extensive global infrastructure with industry-leading security, reliability, and performance.

ns2:group.ns2:title: Why Super Retail Group Trusts AWS with their Customer Data | Amazon Web Services
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Super Retail Group uses AWS to manage their customer data across their four major brands. This allows them to store all their data in one common space and make better decisions when putting their customers first.
Hear from Rick Green, GM of Data Transformation at Super Retail Group on what he likes best about working with AWS.

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [Amazon Web Services]SaladStop! Allows Customers to Personalize Orders Using Amazon Bedrock | Amazon Web Services

ns2:group.ns2:title: SaladStop! Allows Customers to Personalize Orders Using Amazon Bedrock | Amazon Web Services
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Learn how SaladStop!, a popular quick service restaurant (QSR) in Singapore collaborated with AWS to build Lulu, an automated chatbot that allows customers to fully personalize their orders from choosing ingredients all the way to setting calorie amount.
Hear from Adrien Desbaillets, Co-founder and CEO of Saladstop!, on how Amazon Bedrock allows him to continuously innovate and why this is just the beginning.

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [Amazon Web Services]Amazon Bedrock: Fast-track gen AI from prototype to production | Amazon Web Services

ns2:group.ns2:title: Amazon Bedrock: Fast-track gen AI from prototype to production | Amazon Web Services
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Amazon Bedrock is a comprehensive, secure, and flexible platform for building generative AI applications and agents. Amazon Bedrock connects you to leading foundation models (FMs), services to deploy and operate agents, and tools for fine-tuning, safeguarding, and optimizing models along with knowledge bases to connect applications to your latest data so that you have everything you need to quickly move from experimentation to real-world deployment.
Learn more about Amazon Bedrock: http://go.aws/4mS2vSl

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [Amazon Web Services]How fileAI boosted data accuracy 28x using AWS | Amazon Web Services

ns2:group.ns2:title: How fileAI boosted data accuracy 28x using AWS | Amazon Web Services
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Discover how fileAI, a data infrastructure startup, uses Amazon Web Services (AWS) to transform manual data cleanup into automated, reliable workflows that can scale confidently across enterprises. With Anthropic Claude on Amazon Bedrock and Amazon SageMaker, fileAI processes hundreds of millions of files annually while enabling customers to reallocate 10% of their workforce to high-impact strategic tasks. AWS's scalable microservices architecture has enabled fileAI to achieve 28x more accurate data processing than legacy OCR tools, showcasing how well-architected cloud infrastructure can turn data preparation from a bottleneck into a competitive advantage.
Learn more at: http://go.aws/4q33amH
